Title: ‘Nothing short of amazing’: Health DG pays tribute to health workers
Content: PETALING JAYA: The dedication shown by healthcare workers battling Covid-19 in the country is "nothing short of amazing"; says Datuk Seri Dr Noor Hisham Abdullah.

Title: Jakarta buries 283 Covid-19 victims; suspected victims in under a month
Content: JAKARTA (The Jakarta Post/ANN): Nearly 300 suspected and confirmed Covid-19 victims have been buried in Jakarta since the beginning of March; Jakarta Governor Anies Baswedan said on Monday (March 30).

Title: Myanmar reports first coronavirus death as case numbers rise
Content: (Reuters) - Myanmar reported its first coronavirus death on Tuesday; a 69-year-old man who also had cancer and died in a hospital in the commercial capital of Yangon; a government spokeswoman said.

Title: China's manufacturing PMI rebounds in March
Content: BEIJING (Xinhua): The purchasing managers' index (PMI) for China's manufacturing sector firmed up to 52 in March from 35.7 in February; the National Bureau of Statistics (NBS) said Tuesday (March 31).

Title: Coronavirus epidemic 'far from over' in Asia - WHO official
Content: BEIJING (Reuters) - The coronavirus epidemic is "far from over" in the Asia-Pacific region; and the current measures to curb the spread of the virus are merely buying time for countries to prepare for large-scale community transmissions; a WHO official said o…

Title: Covid-19: Disinfection work in Johor to continue up to April 14
Content: JOHOR BARU: The Fire Department along with workers from SwCorp have already started disinfection work in the state and this will continue up to April 14.

Title: Hong Kong uses stool test kits to screen children for Covid-19
Content: HONG KONG (China Daily/ANN): The Hong Kong Department of Health has teamed with the Chinese University of Hong Kong to beef up its capacity to identify patients infected with the novel coronavirus.

Title: Covid-19: 1;600 in Pulau Gaya screened so far; three positive cases detected
Content: KOTA KINABALU: Health officials last week screened 1;600 of Pulau Gaya's population of between 5;000 and 6;000; and detected three positive cases of Covid-19; says Sabah Health Department director Datuk Christina Rundi.

Title: Two senior citizen hikers detained under MCO
Content: JOHOR BARU (Bernama): Two senior citizen hikers may have climbed Gunung Lambak near Kluang on Monday (March 30) but they were not beyond the reach of the law when police detained them for violating the Movement Control Order (MCO).

Title: Exclusive: Japan businessman paid $8.2 million by Tokyo Olympics bid lobbied figure at center of French corruption probe
Content: TOKYO/PARIS (Reuters) - A businessman who received millions of dollars for his work on Tokyo's successful campaign to host the 2020 Olympics; which was postponed last week due to the coronavirus; said he played a key role in securing the support of a former O…

Title: China races to increase output of ventilators
Content: BEIJING (China Daily/ANN): China is racing to produce several thousands of multifunction ventilators; as demand for the lifesaving machines skyrockets across the world due to the Covid-19 pandemic; the country's top industry regulator said on Monday (March 30…

Title: Xi vows aid for smaller businesses hit by Covid-19
Content: HANGZHOU (Xinhua): President Xi Jinping said China will roll out more targeted measures to help small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) hit by the Covid-19 outbreak restart production and further develop.

Title: MCO legal proceedings: Only one family member allowed outside courthouse
Content: GEORGE TOWN: Police were alerted when groups of people gathered at the courthouse here on Tuesday (March 31); and they quickly went to see what was happening.

Title: MCO: Lorry driver gets one month for 'hanging out' with friend
Content: KUALA LUMPUR: A lorry driver was sentenced to one month in jail by a Magistrate's Court in Selayang here on Tuesday (March 31) after he pleaded guilty to violating the movement control order (MCO).

Title: Pessimistic Indian doctors brace for tsunami of Covid-19 cases
Content: NEW DELHI (Bloomberg): It's the phone calls at all hours of the night he remembers. As swine flu ravaged northern India in 2015; a radiologist working at a hospital in a Delhi suburb said people would call begging for a bed.

Title: World Bank: Covid-19 will push 11 million in East Asia; Pacific into poverty
Content: WASHINGTON (The Straits Times/ANN): In a bad case scenario; East Asia and the Pacific could see up to 11 million people driven into poverty; with low wage and informal sector workers the most vulnerable; the World Bank warns in a report on the economic impact…

Title: SMEs; facing bankruptcy; ask for more help
Content: PETALING JAYA: Local SMEs; especially retailers; say not enough help is forthcoming to help them survive the impact of the MCO on their businesses.

Title: Miri PKR MP says he's received RM100k govt allocation for MCO period
Content: MIRI: Miri PKR MP Dr Michael Teo Yu Keng says he has received an emergency fund of RM100;000 from the Federal Government to buy food supplies for the needy in his constituency during the movement control order (MCO).

Title: Covid-19: State-backed players join pandemic cyber crime attacks - The Star Online
Content: Network cables are seen going into a server in an office building in Washington; DC. Hades; linked to the APT28 which is believed to be of Russian origin and behind an attack on the US Democrat party in 2016; was the first state-backed group to use the epidem…

Title: Only one of the infected in Menara City One linked to tabligh cluster; says condo management
Content: PETALING JAYA: Only one of the infected people staying at Menara City One condominium tower on Jalan Munshi Abdullah was linked to the Sri Petaling Mosque tabligh cluster; said a spokesman from the Menara City One management company.

Title: Japan coronavirus infections top 2;000 cases
Content: TOKYO (Reuters) - Coronavirus infections in Japan topped 2;000 cases on Tuesday; according to a Reuters calculation based on ministry data and media reports.

Title: RM1k fine for anyone venturing out? Fake news
Content: PETALING JAYA: A commotion at a supermarket; a RM1;000 fine on anyone who leaves their house and a notice supposedly by the Inspector-General of Police (IGP) – these are among the fake news circulating on social media.

Title: MACC to look into allegations of abuse over Sabah's RM100 MCO assistance
Content: KOTA KINABALU: Graft-busters have set up a task force to look into allegations that the RM100 assistance for groceries for those most affected by the movement control order (MCO) amid the Covid-19 pandemic has been misused.

Title: Many small retailers expected to close shop soon
Content: Many small retailers expected to close shop soon thestar.com.my

Title: Japan urges citizens to stay away from a third of the world
Content: TOKYO (Reuters) - Japan is urging its citizens not to travel to 73 countries and regions; or a third of all countries in the world; Foreign Minister Toshimitsu Motegi said on Tuesday; as the government fights to prevent an explosive surge in coronavirus cases.

Title: Japan PM; Deputy PM to avoid same meetings as precaution vs virus infection
Content: TOKYO (Reuters) - Japan's prime minister and deputy prime minister will avoid attending the same meeting as a precaution against coronavirus infection; a government spokesman said on Tuesday.

Title: Australia's NSW state calls end to brutal fire season
Content: MELBOURNE (Reuters) - New South Wales; the Australian state most severely affected by last summer's wildfires on Tuesday marked the official close to its worst ever bushfire season; which burned more than 6% of the state's land area and killed 25 people.

Title: Don't return through border gates till April 15; Myanmar expats told
Content: YANGON (Xinhua): Myanmar's Foreign Affairs Ministry on Monday (March 30) requested Myanmar expatriates to return to the country through border gates only after April 15 to prevent the spread of Covid-19.

Title: Tech's shadow workforce sidelined; leaving social media to the machines - The Star Online
Content: The Covid-19 pandemic has disrupted the sprawling networks of contract workers who keep social-media services running smoothly.

Title: China's factory activity rebounds as work slowly resumes
Content: BEIJING; (AFP): Factory activity in China rebounded in March from a record low; according to official data released Tuesday (March 31); returning to expansion territory while the coronavirus pandemic continues to devastate the global economy.

Title: Chinese community in US donate medical supplies
Content: NEW YORK (Xinhua): Chinese Americans and local operations of Chinese companies are working together to donate medical supplies to hospitals; police stations and local residents to ease shortages help fight Covid-19 in the United States.

Title: Florida megachurch pastor charged with defying coronavirus stay-at-home orders
Content: (Reuters) - The pastor of a megachurch in Tampa; Florida; was arrested on Monday on charges of holding prayer services in violation of public health orders temporarily banning such gatherings to limit the spread of coronavirus infections; authorities said.

Title: Mexican coronavirus cases pass 1;000; health ministry says
Content: MEXICO CITY (Reuters) - Mexico's health ministry on Monday confirmed 1;094 cases of coronavirus in the country; up from 993 the day before.

Title: South Korea reports 125 new coronavirus cases; total 9;786 - KCDC
Content: SEOUL (Reuters) - South Korea reported 125 new coronavirus cases on Tuesday; bringing the total number of infections to 9;786; the Korea Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said.

Title: What a drag! Self-isolating Aussie queen takes routine online
Content: SYDNEY (Reuters) - An Australian drag queen has shifted her performances from stage to personal screens during coronavirus lockdown in Sydney to ensure she's not all dressed up with nowhere to go.

Title: Chinese firm Fosun delivers medical supplies to Portugal
Content: LISBON (Xinhua): A batch of medical supplies delivered by China's Fosun Group; including 1 million face masks and 200;000 test kits; arrived in Lisbon from China on Monday (March 30); according to a press release by the company.

Title: U.S. panel outlines how doctors should ration care in a pandemic
Content: CHICAGO (Reuters) - A panel of advisers issued recommendations for new crisis treatment standards on Monday advising doctors and hospitals on how they should decide which patients with COVID-19 get lifesaving care and which do not.

Title: Japan says destroyer and Chinese boat collided; no injuries
Content: TOKYO (Reuters) - A Japanese destroyer and a Chinese fishing boat collided in the East China Sea on Monday night but no one was injured or missing; Japan's defence minister said.

Title: First U.S. military servicemember dies from coronavirus
Content: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The first U.S. military service member has died from the coronavirus; the Pentagon said on Monday; as it reported another sharp hike in the number of infected troops.

Title: China reports 48 new imported Covid-19 cases; none in Wuhan
Content: BEIJING (Xinhua): The Chinese mainland reported 48 new imported cases of the novel coronavirus disease (Covid-19) on Monday; bringing the total number of imported cases to 771; the National Health Commission said Tuesday (March 31).

Title: China wants G20 to ensure stability in global supply chains
Content: BEIJING; March 30 (Xinhua) -- The Group of 20 (G20) economies should work together to ensure stability in global industrial and supply chains; said Minister of Commerce Zhong Shan Monday (March 30).

Title: Brazil's Bolsonaro urges no more coronavirus quarantine; says jobs being lost
Content: BRASILIA/RIO DE JANEIRO (Reuters) - Brazil's President Jair Bolsonaro said on Monday that there can be no more quarantine measures imposed on the country than those already in place to combat coronavirus because jobs are being destroyed and the poor are suffe…

Title: New Zealand extends state of emergency to stop spread of COVID-19
Content: WELLINGTON (Reuters) - New Zealand is extending the state of national emergency for a further seven days to help stop the spread of COVID-19; the Minister of Civil Defence Peeni Henare said in a statement.

Title: Australia enacts sweeping lockdown powers to combat coronavirus spread
Content: SYDNEY (Reuters) - People in Australia's most populous state of New South Wales; the epicentre of the coronavirus outbreak in Australia; could be heavily fined or jailed for leaving their home without a good reason from Tuesday under sweeping new powers desig…

Title: In scrappy Cambodian casino town; Chinese plan future beyond coronavirus
Content: SIHANOUKVILLE; Cambodia (Reuters) - *Photo essay: https://reut.rs/3avL9X4

Title: Brazil's Bolsonaro says no more quarantine measures can be imposed
Content: BRASILIA (Reuters) - Brazil's President Jair Bolsonaro said on Monday that no more coronavirus-fighting quarantine measures can be imposed than those already in place because jobs are being destroyed and the poor are suffering.

Title: Social distancing foils secret bids at Pasar Bisik fish market
Content: KEPALA BATAS: There will be no more “whispering” for a while at the Pasar Bisik fish market in Penaga near here during the movement control order (MCO).

Title: Nurliana answers call from Health Ministry to serve country again
Content: GEORGE TOWN: Believing that her country needs her now more than ever; former nurse Nurliana Muhammad; 31; has decided to answer the call from the Health Ministry to serve the country again.

Title: Expert: Crucial for all to maintain healthy diet and regular exercise
Content: PETALING JAYA: As the movement control order (MCO) reaches its halfway mark; the Malaysian Psychiatric Association (MPA) has stepped in to advise the people to keep their mental health in check.

Title: ‘No Parliament sitting’
Content: PETALING JAYA: The government has dismissed calls for an emergency sitting of Parliament to review the RM250bil economic stimulus package; saying there is an immediate danger of the deadly Covid-19 pandemic.

Title: Stricter rules to be enforced during second phase of MCO
Content: PUTRAJAYA: As part of a tightening of measures under the movement control order (MCO); beginning tomorrow; there will be shorter operating hours for businesses that are allowed to open. And the government has warned that there will be more of such stricter ru…

Title: Trump says guidelines to slow coronavirus spread may get tougher
Content: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday that he may toughen up current guidelines aimed at slowing the spread of the coronavirus; which has killed more than 2000 Americans.

Title: Brazil's health minister urges maximum social distancing
Content: BRASILIA (Reuters) - Brazilians should maintain maximum social distancing right now to help ease the strain on the health system caused by the coronavirus epidemic; Health Minister Luiz Henrique Mandetta said on Monday; adding that churches can open but not h…

Title: Trump says more than one million Americans have been tested for coronavirus
Content: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday that more than 1 million Americans had been tested for coronavirus and urged people to continue to follow social distancing measures through April to prevent the virus from spreading.

Title: Pentagon to send mortuary services personnel to New York
Content: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The U.S. military said on Monday it was looking to send mortuary affairs personnel to New York as part of the U.S. government's response to the coronavirus pandemic.

Title: Doctor recommended no action for U.S.' Pelosi after coronavirus contact
Content: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The U.S. Congress' attending physician recommended U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi take no particular action after she was in contact with Representative Nydia Velazquez; who has been diagnosed with coronavirus infection; Pelosi's spoke…

Title: U.S. Congress eyes next steps in coronavirus response
Content: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - Three days after passing a $2.2 trillion (£1.78 trillion) package aimed at easing the heavy economic blow of the coronavirus pandemic; the U.S. Congress on Monday was looking at additional steps it might take as the country's death toll…

Title: U.S. judge stops Texas from curbing abortions during coronavirus crisis
Content: (Reuters) - A U.S. judge on Monday blocked Texas officials from banning most abortions in the state as part of their order to postpone surgeries and procedures deemed not medically necessary during the coronavirus crisis.

Title: Trump coronavirus guidance on keeping gun stores open draws criticism
Content: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - Gun control activists on Monday criticized guidance issued by President Donald Trump's administration recommending that states find that gun stores are critical businesses that can stay open during the coronavirus crisis.

Title: Factbox: Six members of U.S. Congress diagnosed with coronavirus
Content: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - At last six members of the U.S. Congress have announced that they have contracted the novel coronavirus; and more than 30 others are or were self-quarantining in hopes of limiting the spread of the pandemic.

Title: U.S. House Democrats chart next coronavirus aid bill
Content: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The U.S. House of Representatives has begun work on a fourth coronavirus bill targeting a slew of crisis issues from short supplies of medical equipment and protective gear to enhanced worker protections; infrastructure needs and additi…

Title: Senior Italian cardinal; papal vicar for Rome; has coronavirus
Content: ROME (Reuters) - Cardinal Angelo De Donatis; Pope Francis' vicar for the archdiocese of Rome; on Monday became the highest-ranking Catholic official known to test positive for coronavirus.

Title: Italy government to extend lockdown measures until Easter - health minister
Content: ROME (Reuters) - The Italian government on Monday said it would extend a lockdown to prevent a further spread of the coronavirus outbreak at least until Easter; Health Minister Roberto Speranza said in a statement.

Title: COVID-19 hospitalizations double in four days in California - governor
Content: SACRAMENTO; Calif. (Reuters) - California Governor Gavin Newsom said on Monday that the number of COVID-19 hospitalizations in the state had doubled over the past four days; and the number of ICU patients tripled during that time.

Title: Turkey must 'keep wheels turning' despite coronavirus; Erdogan says
Content: ANKARA (Reuters) - Turkey must carry on producing and "keep wheels turning" through the coronavirus pandemic to support exports and sustain the supply of basic goods; President Tayyip Erdogan said on Monday; as the number of confirmed cases topped 10;000.

Title: Czechs extend restrictions on restaurants; movement until April 11
Content: PRAGUE (Reuters) - The Czech government said on Monday it would order most shops and restaurants to stay closed and restrict people's movement until April 11; extending by 10 days measures it has put in place to curb the spread of the coronavirus.

Title: U.S. expected to renew sanctions waivers allowing Iran nonproliferation work - sources
Content: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The United States is expected to allow Russian; Chinese and European companies to continue their work at Iranian nuclear sites to make it harder for Tehran to develop nuclear weapons; four sources familiar with the matter said on Monday.

Title: Germany's Merkel to work from home despite negative coronavirus test
Content: BERLIN (Reuters) - Germany's Chancellor Angela Merkel will continue to lead the government from home; despite testing negative for coronavirus for a third time; a German government spokesman said on Monday.

Title: Finland extends coronavirus restrictions by one month -PM
Content: HELSINKI (Reuters) - Finland will extend its earlier measures to contain the coronavirus outbreak by one month until May 13 from April 13; Finland's Prime Minister Sanna Marin said on Monday.

Title: France sees worst daily death toll; fourth country to report 3;000 virus deaths
Content: PARIS (Reuters) - French health authorities reported 418 new deaths from coronavirus on Monday; taking the total to 3;024 or an increase of 16%; France becoming the fourth country to cross the 3;000 fatalities threshold after China; Italy; and Spain.

Title: Pelosi to discuss worker; patient safety in next coronavirus response bill on Monday
Content: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - U.S. House of Representatives Speaker Nancy Pelosi will hold a news conference call at 3 p.m. (1900 GMT) on Monday to discuss the planned fourth coronavirus response bill; focusing on how to meet worker and patient safety needs; accordi…

Title: New York governor calls on healthcare workers to come help state
Content: (Reuters) - New York Governor Andrew Cuomo on Monday called on healthcare professionals from across the United States to come to his state and help its hospitals deal with the surge in coronavirus cases; which has killed more than 1;200 people in the state.

Title: European researchers retrofit snorkel masks for coronavirus fight
Content: PRAGUE/BRUSSELS (Reuters) - Researchers in Europe have been converting low-cost snorkel masks into respirators to treat patients or protection for medical workers battling to contain the coronavirus outbreak that has stretched healthcare resources.

Title: Coronavirus hits hundreds of U.S. police amid protective gear shortages
Content: New York (Reuters) - When nine police officers showed up to make an arrest near Melrose Avenue in the Bronx last Wednesday; none wore a mask or gloves to protect them from coronavirus.

Title: Poland vote could be postponed if safety not guaranteed - president
Content: WARSAW (Reuters) - Poland should consider postponing presidential elections scheduled for May 10 if health and safety conditions can't be guaranteed; Poland's President Andrzej Duda said on Monday.

Title: French fire crews swap hoses for masks to fight coronavirus
Content: STRASBOURG; France (Reuters) - French fire crews accustomed to attending road traffic accidents and putting out fires are adapting to a new line of work -- first responders in the fight against coronavirus.

Title: Netflix Malaysia to reduce video quality; starting March 31
Content: Netflix will be tweaking the quality of its HD and UHD content as part of a measure to reduce its bandwidth consumption by 25% in Malaysia.

Title: Turkey's coronavirus deaths up to 168; with 10;827 total cases - minister
Content: ISTANBUL (Reuters) - Turkey's deaths from the new coronavirus increased by 37 to 168 on Monday; as the number of confirmed cases rose by 1;610 to 10;827; Health Minister Fahrettin Koca said.

Title: Earthquake shakes Afghanistan; Pakistan
Content: KABUL/ ISLAMABAD (Reuters) - An earthquake shook some buildings in Afghanistan and Pakistan on Monday; witnesses said.

Title: Norway to admit non-resident Europeans working in oil; agriculture; easing some coronavirus curbs
Content: OSLO (Reuters) - Norway will allow entry to certain European citizens for work in sectors critically short of labour including agriculture and the oil industry despite its lockdown to fight the coronavirus pandemic; the government said on Monday.

Title: Italy coronavirus deaths rise by 812; number of new cases falls sharply
Content: ROME (Reuters) - The death toll from an outbreak of coronavirus in Italy climbed by 812 to 11;591; the Civil Protection Agency said on Monday; reversing two days of declines in the daily rate.

Title: Spain eyes suspension of some rent payments and evictions - government source
Content: MADRID (Reuters) - Spain's government is fleshing out a 700-million-euro ($770 million) package to help private tenants through the coronavirus crisis and is likely to suspend evictions and rental payments for several months; a government source said on Monda…

Title: Denmark may gradually lift lockdown after Easter if coronavirus numbers stay stable - PM
Content: COPENHAGEN (Reuters) - Denmark may gradually lift a lockdown after Easter if the numbers of corona cases and deaths stay stable; Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen said on Monday.

Title: Italy's epidemic should stabilise soon; but vigilance needed - WHO
Content: GENEVA (Reuters) - Lockdowns and stringent measures in place in Italy for the past two weeks should lead soon to a stabilisation in its coronavirus epidemic; but vigilant follow-up will be required; a senior official of the World Health Organization (WHO) sai…

Title: Jogger among dozens of M’sians brought to court for non-compliance
Content: GEORGE TOWN: A cardiologist in Penang is among dozens of Malay­sians charged with defying the movement control order (MCO).

Title: Five-year-old girl is latest rabies victim
Content: KUCHING: A five-year-old girl from Sibu who died last week after being bitten by a dog is the latest rabies victim in Sarawak; said the Health Ministry.

Title: Enhanced MCO jolts Sg Lui folk into reality
Content: KLANG: It took an enhanced movement control order (MCO) to jolt people in several communities in Sungai Lui; Hulu Langat; into realising that their area has a high number of confirmed Covid-19 cases.

Title: KL condo under EMCO after 17 cases detected
Content: PETALING JAYA: Residents of a condominium in Kuala Lumpur’s city centre will face stricter movement restrictions after 17 confirmed Covid-19 cases were detected there; said Senior Minister Datuk Seri Ismail Sabri Yaakob.

Title: The everlasting gift of kindness
Content: More than 1;400 years ago; a woman decided to be kind to an infant despite no promise of a reward. It’s a story whose lesson continues to resonate today.

Title: Drones to monitor compliance in Hulu Langat
Content: KAJANG: Drones are now being used to monitor compliance with the enhanced movement control order (MCO) in the Sungai Lui area in Hulu Langat; says Tan Sri Abdul Hamid Bador.

Title: Coronavirus death toll in Italy's Lombardy rises by around 458 in a day - source
Content: ROME (Reuters) - The death toll from an outbreak of coronavirus in the northern region of Lombardy; the epicentre of Italy's contagion; has risen by around 458 in a day to some 6;818; a source familiar with the data said on Monday.

Title: Cyprus imposes peacetime curfew; extending coronavirus lockdown
Content: NICOSIA (Reuters) - Cyprus imposed a curfew on Monday to contain the spread of coronavirus; extending a broad lockdown introduced two weeks ago after a weekend spike in recorded cases.

Title: France uses army helicopters to ferry critical virus patients abroad
Content: STRASBOURG/PARIS (Reuters) - Army helicopters on Monday transported coronavirus patients fighting for their lives from eastern France to hospitals in Germany and Switzerland as the country battled to free up space in life-support units.

Title: Outrage in India as migrants sprayed with disinfectant to fight coronavirus
Content: NEW DELHI (Reuters) - Indian health workers caused outrage on Monday by spraying a group of migrants with disinfectant; amid fears that a large scale movement of people from cities to the countryside risked spreading the coronavirus.

Title: South Africa policeman; guard shot man dead during lockdown - police
Content: JOHANNESBURG (Reuters) - South African police said on Monday a policeman and security guard had shot a man dead during the coronavirus lockdown.

Title: Italy expected to maintain lockdown as it awaits steady coronavirus decline
Content: ROME (Reuters) - Italy looks certain to remain under lockdown for at least two more weeks; officials said on Monday; with the number of new coronavirus cases yet to show a decisive decline.

Title: Kazakhstan hopes coronavirus cases won't top 3;500 - minister
Content: ALMATY (Reuters) - Kazakhstan hopes to keep the number of coronavirus cases within 3;500 over the next two months; with the rate of infection peaking next month; Healthcare Minister Yelzhan Birtanov said on Monday.

Title: Hard times shape speedy Saudi and Kuwaiti coronavirus response
Content: RIYADH/KUWAIT (Reuters) - The world's last major coronavirus outbreak; in 2012; began in Saudi Arabia; where a faltering response allowed the Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS) to kill several hundred people and spread across the region.

Title: Some ultra-Orthodox Israelis chafe at coronavirus restrictions
Content: JERUSALEM (Reuters) - Israeli police have used a drone; helicopter and stun grenades in recent days to prevent people gathering in an ultra-Orthodox Jewish neighbourhood of Jerusalem in defiance of Health Ministry measures aimed at slowing the spread of the c…
